definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Before the Chamber, in the banquet hall, offering the hall at the back.
sentences.chinese: 前爲議事廳，中是宴會廳，祭把廳在後面。

sentences.english: When I entered the banquet lobby, they always stood up and queried me to sit on the salt.
sentences.chinese: 我走進宴會廳時，他們都站起來，請我坐上席。

sentences.english: The bellman will show you the way to the Grand Ballroom.
sentences.chinese: 行李員將領您去國際宴會廳。

sentences.english: The gatecrasher was forced out of the banquet hall by security staff.
sentences.chinese: 闖席的人被保安強行的拉出了宴會廳。

sentences.english: The walls of the banqueting hall were hung with tapestries.
sentences.chinese: 宴會廳的牆上掛着繡帷。

sentences.english: The"Party Room" facility vill add enjoyment to your visit.
sentences.chinese: 此外，還有設有宴會廳等設施，爲您的旅行增添樂趣。

sentences.english: The guests gathered in the banquet hall, the Great Hall of the People, which was filled with warm and festive atmosphere. The national emblem was placed above the podium.
sentences.chinese: 人民大會堂宴會廳內賓朋濟濟一堂，氣氛喜慶熱烈。

sentences.english: Another acquaintance is a convention and banquet manager at a prominent resort.
sentences.chinese: 另一個熟人是某處旅遊勝地的宴會廳經理。

sentences.english: Learn to salsa and ballroom dance in this free dancing video lesson.
sentences.chinese: 學習莎莎舞和宴會廳在這個自由跳舞的視頻課。

definition: meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
